title: Initial .cuda() slow occur again at the latest cuda9 version PyTorch
body_html:
Similar to #537. the first call of .cuda() take a very long time. It take even more on a model.cuda().

import torch
from datetime import datetime

for i in range(10):
    x = torch.randn(10, 10, 10, 10) # similar timings regardless of the tensor size
    t1 = datetime.now()
    x.cuda()
    print(i, datetime.now() - t1)
0 0:03:03.546126
1 0:00:00.000111
2 0:00:00.000065
3 0:00:00.000057
4 0:00:00.000052
5 0:00:00.000051
6 0:00:00.000050
7 0:00:00.000047
8 0:00:00.000046
9 0:00:00.000046

PyTorch install with conda: conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch.
GPU: GTX 1080 and CUDA9.0.

body:
Similar to #537. the first call of .cuda() take a very long time. It take even more on a model.cuda().

```python
import torch
from datetime import datetime

for i in range(10):
    x = torch.randn(10, 10, 10, 10) # similar timings regardless of the tensor size
    t1 = datetime.now()
    x.cuda()
    print(i, datetime.now() - t1)
```

```
0 0:03:03.546126
1 0:00:00.000111
2 0:00:00.000065
3 0:00:00.000057
4 0:00:00.000052
5 0:00:00.000051
6 0:00:00.000050
7 0:00:00.000047
8 0:00:00.000046
9 0:00:00.000046
```

PyTorch install with conda: `conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch`. 
GPU: GTX 1080 and CUDA9.0.
